channel.title: Denver Homeless Out Loud
channel.description: Posts from Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.title: The City of Denver SWEEPS away approximately 60 people at 14th...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

The City of Denver SWEEPS away approximately 60 people at 14th and Logan this morning.

Once again, the City used fencing in order to prevent volunteers from assisting our unhoused
community members. Fencing began early at 5:30am. DHOL staff, neighbors, outreach
workers, advocates and press witnessed at least 10 tents thrown away in a garbage truck with...
those residents’ personal belongings still inside of them. One couple left to get a cart for their
things and they were denied re-entry and all of their belongings were thrown away in a garbage
truck.
One resident and plaintiff in the lawsuit filed yesterday was arrested while clearly in distress
over having to move repeatedly.
TOMORROW the City of Denver plans to SWEEP the following block. Please come and support
our unhoused community members at 14 th and Pennsylvania and support residents of these
encampments as they demand real housing or places where they are allowed to survive.

Bring the following things to assist residents:
-Truck, or any vehicle to help move
-Carts
-Bungee Cords/Rope
-Trash Bags
-Food
-Coffee/CoCo
-Water

Your assistance is much appreciated! Somewhere around 7am and all morning help will likely
be needed.

Toward Rights, Dignity and Housing…

See More
item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.title: Race and Homelessness Vigil 5256 Minutes for Every Black...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Race and Homelessness Vigil
5256 Minutes for Every Black Indigenous and Person of Color Who is Homeless in Denver

Starting on Wednesday October 14th at 7am we will be holding space in front of City Hall for 5256 minutes (equaling 89 hours) ending October 17th at 10pm. This is to honor and stand for every BIPOC who is homeless in Denver right now.

...Continue Reading
item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.title: We know this story ... in the comments you will find how they...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

We know this story ... in the comments you will find how they used the same technique to hide land under a community garden. I the case we will share in the comments that used to have public housing on it. With some patience exersized by the realestate lobby investors they managed to exchange it for 300K+$ condos.

Make you wonder what they are planning to build on this plot of land? We are thinking it will not be budget housing. In a city that 87% of the renters make 35K ...or less what kind of housing do you think they have plans to build on it? Since the city did not buy it there will not be public housing on it, since the linkage fee has no enforcement behind it there is likely not to be any affordable housing included in it... do you follow me?

Do you see how this works yet? If not expect your rent to double in 5 years. That is exactly half the time it took them to double your rent last time playing this game. A game where you lose and many wind up out on the streets

.https://www.denverpost.com/…/denver-urban-gardens-el-oasi…/…

https://www.denverpost.com/…/denver-urban-gardens-el-oasi…/…

See MoreMembers of a Denver community garden that supplies local food banks fight to save it from developers.

denverpost.com

A plot of land given to Denver Urban Gardens for $1 to house a community garden will be sold to developers for $1.2 million

Members of a Denver community garden that supplies local food banks fight to save it from developers.Members of a Denver community garden that supplies local food banks fight to save it from developers.

item.title: Oh look... empty tents locked in a fence. Do you feel safe yet? ...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Oh look... empty tents locked in a fence. Do you feel safe yet?

Come on Denver DO BETTER. Fill those tents up with people in an organized way. Why are you putting off? People are already in tents all over the city. It will be so much better to have some orgaization than the curent disorganization along the sidewalks in the city. We are in a housing crisis. One that will remain with us long after the pandemic passes.

Orgaized camps will be so much better than terrorizi...ng our homeless with sweeps every week. It will also be so much less expensive than the law suits our city officials are setting us up for. Plus all the health and safety benifits of being orgaized and having Bathrooms, trash removal etc availible.

https://denverite.com/…/wonder-what-sanctioned-camping-is…/…

See MoreAnd talk to representatives of the nonprofits that want to bring what’s also known as safe outdoor spaces to Denver.

denverite.com

Wonder what sanctioned camping is all about? Check out a demonstration in Capitol Hill

And talk to representatives of the nonprofits that want to bring what’s also known as safe outdoor spaces to Denver.And talk to representatives of the nonprofits that want to bring what’s also known as safe outdoor spaces to Denver.

item.title: They are fenced in. Large numbers of police. Residents not...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

They are fenced in.
Large numbers of police.
Residents not currently in the camp- like those who worked the night shift somewhere are being told they cannot return to retrieve their belongings. Not being able to retrieve belongings is a clear violation of Lyall vs Denver. This and many other actions like it is going to cost the city a lot of money. Money they could spend on housing, but apparently the city would rather be mean and get sued for it later rather than to be just and good. Do Better Denver...

Denver Homeless Out Loud was live.

item.title: Lawsuit Filed Against the Sweeps and the City’s Ongoing...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Lawsuit Filed Against the Sweeps and the City’s Ongoing Violations of Lawsuit Settlement

Today, October 5th 2020, a lawsuit and motion for preliminary injunction was filed against the City of Denver for violating constitutional rights of homeless individuals, and violating the agreed upon settlement from Lyall v CIty of Denver, in on-going sweeps. The suit is filed by Andrew McNaulty of Killmer Lane and Newman on behalf of 10 homeless individuals as well as all others in the ...class of homeless people and those of us from Denver Homeless Out Loud who have suffered from sweeps. This case seeks an injunction to stop the homeless sweeps (and enforcement of the Camping Ban) during the COVID-19 pandemic (and afterwards), the seizure of homeless individuals’ property without notice, the destruction of homeless individuals’ property, and the continuing violation of the Lyall v. Denver settlement agreement.

This lawsuit comes after a series of egregious sweeps conducted by the City with no notice at Lincoln Park at the end of July, Morey Middle School at the beginning of August, and along the South Platte River a week ago. In addition, at least 20 other sweeps, plus daily camping ban enforcement, have continued to occur during the COVID-19 pandemic.

The City cannot continue to blatantly violate the rights of people without housing and furthermore violate the settlement agreement they made with the homeless community to give proper notice prior to sweeps and to store property instead of trashing it. The City cannot continue to ignore CDC guidance to not sweep and to instead provide sanitation resources where people live in encampments.

Plaintiffs in this case lost medications, irreplaceable memorabilia, all their protection from the elements, and have been pushed into congregate shelters where one lead plaintiff with a heart condition could have died when they caught COVID.

Our City refuses to listen to the cries of the people to stop this inhumane insanity, so we have no choice but to take this cry to the courts.

Pictures of lead plaintiff and neighbors of 14th and Logan camp speaking at press conference today

See More+27
